  1. Write a program to find addition and subtraction of two matrices

#include <iostream>

  

using namespace std;

  

int main() {

Â  // Declare variables for the dimensions of the matrices

Â  int numRows, numCols;

  

Â  // Get the dimensions of the matrices from the user

Â  cout << "Enter the number of rows: ";

Â  cin >> numRows;

Â  cout << "Enter the number of columns: ";

Â  cin >> numCols;

  

Â  // Declare the matrices with the given dimensions

Â  int matrix1[numRows][numCols];

Â  int matrix2[numRows][numCols];

  

Â  // Get the values for the first matrix from the user

Â  cout << "Enter the values for the first matrix: " << endl;

Â  for (int i = 0; i < numRows; i++) {

Â  Â  for (int j = 0; j < numCols; j++) {

Â  Â  Â  cout << "Enter value for row " << i+1 << ", column " << j+1 << ": ";

Â  Â  Â  cin >> matrix1[i][j];

Â  Â  }

Â  }

  

Â  // Get the values for the second matrix from the user

Â  cout << "Enter the values for the second matrix: " << endl;

Â  for (int i = 0; i < numRows; i++) {

Â  Â  for (int j = 0; j < numCols; j++) {

Â  Â  Â  cout << "Enter value for row " << i+1 << ", column " << j+1 << ": ";

Â  Â  Â  cin >> matrix2[i][j];

Â  Â  }

Â  }

  

Â  // Ask the user whether to add or subtract the matrices

Â  char operation;

Â  cout << "Enter 'a' to add the matrices or 's' to subtract the matrices: ";

Â  cin >> operation;

  

Â  // Declare a third matrix to store the result of the operation

Â  int result[numRows][numCols];

  

Â  // Perform the chosen operation and store the result in the third matrix

Â  for (int i = 0; i < numRows; i++) {

Â  Â  for (int j = 0; j < numCols; j++) {

Â  Â  Â  if (operation == 'a') {

Â  Â  Â  Â  result[i][j] = matrix1[i][j] + matrix2[i][j];

Â  Â  Â  } else if (operation == 's') {

Â  Â  Â  Â  result[i][j] = matrix1[i][j] - matrix2[i][j];

Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  }

Â  }

  

Â  // Print the result matrix

Â  cout << "The result of the operation is: " << endl;

Â  for (int i = 0; i < numRows; i++) {

Â  Â  for (int j = 0; j < numCols; j++) {

Â  Â  Â  cout << result[i][j] << " ";

Â  Â  }

Â  Â  cout << endl;

Â  }

  

Â  return 0;

}

  1. Write a program to find multiplication of two matrices

#include <iostream>

  

using namespace std;

  

int main()

{

Â  // Declare variables for the dimensions of the matrices

Â  int numRows1, numCols1, numRows2, numCols2;

  

Â  // Get the dimensions of the first matrix from the user

Â  cout << "Enter the number of rows for the first matrix: ";

Â  cin >> numRows1;

Â  cout << "Enter the number of columns for the first matrix: ";

Â  cin >> numCols1;

  

Â  // Get the dimensions of the second matrix from the user

Â  cout << "Enter the number of rows for the second matrix: ";

Â  cin >> numRows2;

Â  cout << "Enter the number of columns for the second matrix: ";

Â  cin >> numCols2;

  

Â  // Make sure the matrices are compatible for multiplication

Â  if (numCols1 != numRows2) {

Â  Â  cout << "Error: The matrices cannot be multiplied." << endl;

Â  Â  return 1;

Â  }

  

Â  // Declare the matrices with the given dimensions

Â  int matrix1[numRows1][numCols1];

Â  int matrix2[numRows2][numCols2];

  

Â  // Get the values for the first matrix from the user

Â  cout << "Enter the values for the first matrix: " << endl;

Â  for (int i = 0; i < numRows1; i++) {

Â  Â  for (int j = 0; j < numCols1; j++) {

Â  Â  Â  cout << "Enter value for row " << i+1 << ", column " << j+1 << ": ";

Â  Â  Â  cin >> matrix1[i][j];

Â  Â  }

Â  }

  

Â  // Get the values for the second matrix from the user

Â  cout << "Enter the values for the second matrix: " << endl;

Â  for (int i = 0; i < numRows2; i++) {

Â  Â  for (int j = 0; j < numCols2; j++) {

Â  Â  Â  cout << "Enter value for row " << i+1 << ", column " << j+1 << ": ";

Â  Â  Â  cin >> matrix2[i][j];

Â  Â  }

Â  }

  

Â  // Declare a third matrix to store the result of the multiplication

Â  int result[numRows1][numCols2];

  

Â  // Initialize all elements of the result matrix to 0

Â  for (int i = 0; i < numRows1; i++) {

Â  Â  for (int j = 0; j < numCols2; j++) {

Â  Â  Â  result[i][j] = 0;

Â  Â  }

Â  }

  

Â  // Multiply the two matrices and store the result in the third matrix

Â  for (int i = 0; i < numRows1; i++) {

Â  Â  for (int j = 0; j < numCols2; j++) {

Â  Â  Â  for (int k = 0; k < numCols1; k++) {

Â  Â  Â  Â  result[i][j] += matrix1[i][k] * matrix2[k][j];

Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  }

Â  }

  

Â  // Print the result matrix

Â  Â  cout << "The result of multiplying the two matrices is: " << endl;

Â  Â  for (int i = 0; i < numRows1; i++) {

Â  Â  for (int j = 0; j < numCols2; j++) {

Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << result[i][j] << " ";

Â  Â  }

Â  Â  cout << endl;

Â  Â  }

  

Â  Â  return 0;

  

}

  1. Write a program to find transpose of a matrix.

#include <iostream>

  

using namespace std;

  

int main()

{

Â  Â  // Declare variables for the dimensions of the matrix

Â  Â  int numRows, numCols;

  

Â  Â  // Get the dimensions of the matrix from the user

Â  Â  cout << "Enter the number of rows: ";

Â  Â  cin >> numRows;

Â  Â  cout << "Enter the number of columns: ";

Â  Â  cin >> numCols;

  

Â  Â  // Declare the matrix with the given dimensions

Â  Â  int matrix[numRows][numCols];

  

Â  Â  // Get the values for the matrix from the user

Â  Â  cout << "Enter the values for the matrix: " << endl;

Â  Â  for (int i = 0; i < numRows; i++)

Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  for (int j = 0; j < numCols; j++)

Â  Â  Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << "Enter value for row " << i + 1 << ", column " << j + 1 << ": ";

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  cin >> matrix[i][j];

Â  Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  }

  

Â  Â  // Declare a new matrix to store the transpose of the original matrix

Â  Â  int transpose[numCols][numRows];

  

Â  Â  // Transpose the matrix and store the result in the new matrix

Â  Â  for (int i = 0; i < numRows; i++)

Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  for (int j = 0; j < numCols; j++)

Â  Â  Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  transpose[j][i] = matrix[i][j];

Â  Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  }

  

Â  Â  // Print the transposed matrix

Â  Â  cout << "The transposed matrix is: " << endl;

Â  Â  for (int i = 0; i < numCols; i++)

Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  for (int j = 0; j < numRows; j++)

Â  Â  Â  Â  {

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << transpose[i][j] << " ";

Â  Â  Â  Â  }

Â  Â  Â  Â  cout << endl;

Â  Â  }

  

Â  Â  return 0;

}
